title: Current density - J equals ar between R and 2R

content.question: The figure shows a cross section of a hollow cylindrical conductor. The conductor’s inner radius is <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and its outer radius is <math alttext="2 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>. There is a current only in the conducting region <math alttext="uppercase R, less than lowercase r, less than 2 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi><mo><</mo><mi>r</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>, where <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is the distance from the conductor’s central axis. The current is nonuniform and has a current density given by <math alttext="J of lowercase r, equals a times lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>J</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>r</mi></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>a</mi></mstyle></math> is a constant with appropriate units. What is the total current in the conductor?

choices.label: <math alttext="fourteen thirds pi a, times uppercase R cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>14</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>
